title: Multiscale Orientation Values for Biodiversity, Climate and Water: A Scientific Input for Science- Based Targets
abstract: arXiv:2403.11680v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: In this study, we explore a range of options and outcomes associated with using different allocation approaches to operationalise the Planetary Boundaries (PB) framework at the country, sector, and city scales. We demonstrate: (i) how to translate the PB framework into various sub-global scales (countries, cities, industries); and (ii) how to take global/local aspects (e.g., water use at the watershed level) into account. Finally, we apply the proposed methodology to derive country, city, and sector-specific budgets consistent with the PB concept for Switzerland. We then benchmark the translated PBs for climate, biodiversity, and freshwater use against actual environmental pressures in Switzerland from both production- and consumption-based perspectives. This effectively enables us to provide a comprehensive assessment of whether Switzerland is living within its safe operating space.

translated_title: 多尺度取向值对生物多样性、气候和水资源的影响：基于科学的指标
translated_abstract: 在本研究中，我们探讨了使用不同的分配方法来实施国家、部门和城市规模的行星边界（PB）框架所涉及的一系列选择和结果。我们展示了：（i）如何将PB框架转化为各种亚全球规模（国家、城市、产业）；以及（ii）如何考虑全球/本地方面（例如，在流域水利用）。 最后，我们将所提出的方法应用到瑞士，以制定符合PB概念的国家、城市和部门特定预算。然后，我们将翻译后的PB在气候、生物多样性和淡水使用方面与瑞士实际环境压力进行基准比较，从生产和消费角度综合评估瑞士是否在其安全运营空间内生活。
tldr: 本研究展示了如何将行星边界框架转化为不同规模的国家、城市和产业，然后将其应用到瑞士，评估其是否在安全运营空间内生活。
